title: Accessory Dwelling Unit (ADU) - Toronto
description: Structured checklist for homeowners planning an ADU (basement unit, laneway suite, garden suite, or second unit) in the City of Toronto.

checklist_items.title: Zoning Review / Zoning Clearance
checklist_items.description: Confirm current zoning permits the proposed ADU type (e.g., laneway suite, basement apartment). Check lot coverage, setbacks, height, parking and accessory building rules.
checklist_items.docs_required: Property deed/assessment, site plan showing setbacks, existing and proposed drawings
checklist_items.condition: Required to determine whether a minor variance or rezoning is necessary
checklist_items.notes: Toronto zoning rules vary by zone; laneway suites have specific policy guidance â€” confirm with planning staff if unsure.

checklist_items.title: Building Permit
checklist_items.description: Apply for a Building Permit to ensure compliance with the Ontario Building Code (structural, fire separation, egress, insulation).
checklist_items.docs_required: Completed permit application, site plan, floor plans, elevations, construction drawings, designer/architect contact
checklist_items.condition: Required for new separate dwelling units or changes affecting occupancy or structure
checklist_items.notes: Small projects may be handled as renovations but fire separations and egress requirements for secondary units must meet OBC standards.

checklist_items.title: Laneway Suite Policy / Guidelines (if applicable)
checklist_items.description: If proposing a laneway suite, verify applicable laneway suite policies, design guidelines and lot-specific constraints.
checklist_items.condition: Applies when the ADU is a laneway suite
checklist_items.notes: Toronto's laneway policies include design guidelines and servicing considerations (stormwater, access).

checklist_items.title: Tree Protection / Removal Permit (if applicable)
checklist_items.description: If protected or significant trees will be impacted, obtain a tree permit or comply with the city's tree protection rules.
checklist_items.docs_required: Tree inventory, arborist report, mitigation plan
checklist_items.condition: Applies when construction affects trees on or adjacent to the property
checklist_items.notes: Tree permits can delay construction; verify early and consider mitigation plans to preserve trees.

checklist_items.title: Sewer/Septic Review
checklist_items.description: Confirm municipal sewer capacity or on-site septic allowance for additional unit; rural properties may need septic upgrades.
checklist_items.docs_required: Septic records or municipal sewer connection confirmation
checklist_items.condition: Applies when adding plumbing fixtures or in areas without municipal sewer services
checklist_items.notes: Most Toronto properties are connected to municipal sewer; confirm with municipal utility if unclear.

checklist_items.title: Electrical Permit / ESA Notification
checklist_items.description: Ensure electrical work is permitted and performed by a licensed electrician; major service changes normally require ESA notification or permit.
checklist_items.docs_required: Electrical scope, electrician contact, single-line wiring diagram if service changes
checklist_items.condition: Required for new circuits, panels, or increased service capacity
checklist_items.notes: Follow Electrical Safety Authority guidance for permit triggers and licensed contractor requirements.

checklist_items.title: Plumbing Permit
checklist_items.description: Plumbing permit for new fixtures or drainage changes associated with the ADU.
checklist_items.condition: Required if adding new plumbing fixtures or altering drainage
checklist_items.notes: If the ADU adds a bathroom/kitchen, plumbing permitting is likely required.

checklist_items.title: Heritage / Conservation Review (if applicable)
checklist_items.description: Check whether the property is in a heritage area or is a heritage-designated property and whether additional approvals are required.
checklist_items.condition: Applies if the property is listed or in a heritage conservation district
checklist_items.notes: Heritage restrictions can affect exterior alterations and may require additional approvals.

checklist_items.title: Fees, Development Charges & HST
checklist_items.description: Review applicable municipal fees, possible development charges, and HST treatment for construction and services.
checklist_items.condition: Review before contracting work; incorporate HST (Ontario 13%) into cost estimates
checklist_items.notes: Some small renovations have different HST treatments; verify with CRA guidance or your accountant.

checklist_items.title: Pre-application / Neighbour Consultation (recommended)
checklist_items.description: Consider a pre-application meeting with planning staff and consult neighbours for complex proposals, variances, or laneway suites.
checklist_items.condition: Recommended for complex projects or where variances are likely
checklist_items.notes: A pre-application meeting can surface constraints early and reduce formal review time.
